content.body: Domenic: FYI: https://github.com/whatwg/storage/pull/130 also failed participation check (I usually fix these by just telling participate to update the PR)
content.formatted_body: Domenic: FYI: https://github.com/whatwg/storage/pull/130 also failed participation check (I usually fix these by just telling participate to update the PR)

content.body: Domenic: we should maybe have a better endpoint for that. E.g., I can browse to https://participate.whatwg.org/agreement-status?user=annevk&repo=storage and submit the URL of that PR there and it all works out, but it's a lil weird to have to fill in a (random) user and repo.
content.formatted_body: Domenic: we should maybe have a better endpoint for that. E.g., I can browse to https://participate.whatwg.org/agreement-status?user=annevk&repo=storage and submit the URL of that PR there and it all works out, but it's a lil weird to have to fill in a (random) user and repo.

content.body: The logs look fine... the webhook payload was delivered and the server sent back a 204
I guess we could add more logging, and maybe send that back instead of a 204

Like maybe some random thing happened which caused one of the early bailouts in this function to be hit before we got to createCommitStatus(): https://github.com/whatwg/participate.whatwg.org/blob/main/lib/pr-webhook.js#L6-L40
